alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, western Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pine Hill, or near Mount Vernon, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Withers, Donaro and Gauley around 455 PM EDT. Jep Hill, Cooksburg, Horse Lick, Lamero and Bummer around 500 PM EDT. Robinet, Cruise, Johnetta, Goochland, Templer, Mershons, Threelinks and Climax around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dango, Loam, Ardery, Middlefork, Carico, Parrot, Eberle, Peoples, Shop Branch, Collingsworth, Eglon, Deese, Dabolt, Sandgap, Cornelius, Bond and Annville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
